function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Global health crisis covid-19 pandemic impacting professional opinions regarding occupant health in buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Not all respondents answering all survey questions","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Online survey with open comment question on health in buildings may pose privacy and confidentiality risks for respondents.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Professionals’ responses may vary based on individual perspectives and biases, leading to subjective data collection.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Professionals may not prioritize occupant health in building design and operation.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of focus on occupant health in building projects.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Data-related challenges in achieving design and operation of buildings that promote occupant health.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mix of academia and industry respondents may lead to conflicting views on occupant health in buildings.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited representation of doctors and public health workers in the survey may lead to a lack of expertise in health assessment.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic impact on building professional opinions may result in temporary shifts that are not sustainable for long-term health assessment strategies.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unequal focus on physical well-being in research","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited research on social well-being in the built environment","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of highly infectious airborne virus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate guidelines for building attributes","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited research on building attributes","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality due to pollutants such as volatile organic compounds, carbon monoxide, nitrogen dioxide, and particulates","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on ventilation and indoor air quality, exacerbated by the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to musculoskeletal pain and mental health issues related to building design","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to sick building syndrome symptoms like red/watery eyes, runny/blocked nose, itchy/dry throat and skin.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited research on ergonomics settings in buildings and its musculoskeletal consequences on occupants.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discrepancy between professionals’ opinions about the prevalence of musculoskeletal pain and limited research focus in this area.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of stress, depression, and anxiety due to stay-at-home mandates and lack of social connections.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concentration loss and stress as part of sick building syndrome","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collaboration needed between building scientists and health professionals","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for more research on mental well-being in built environments","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in effectively collecting and analyzing physiological and psychometric data, requiring coordination with data scientists and comprehensive data storage and analysis infrastructure.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited use of physiological/psychometric measurements for occupant health assessments","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited use of objective health measures in research studies","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low level of experience in improving occupant health in commercial and industrial buildings.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited studies and research on occupant health in commercial and industrial buildings.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Importance given to office spaces in research and practice, leading to neglect of other building types.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Health issues persist with degraded ieq in building types","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of research on different building types and their impact on occupant health","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited awareness and education among building professionals about the impact of their decisions on occupant health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration between building practitioners, health professionals, and data scientists in enhancing the design of healthy buildings.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of occupant-centric building operation modules","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient influence of facility managers on building health","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of understanding about the effects of buildings attributes on occupant health","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of effective collaboration between project stakeholders","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of interest from employers and building owners","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reluctance to share personal data is a significant challenge for achieving the design and operation of buildings that support and promote occupant health.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in defining quantitative metrics for occupant health in buildings","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty of linking building-related data to occupant health","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive measurement of economic value of health in buildings","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of healthy building performance during extreme events","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disparities in health conditions based on income and race","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of optimal layouts for physical distancing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited emphasis on designing, constructing, and operating buildings with occupant health and well-being as an objective","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resistance to the healthy building movement","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Scarcity of real-world cases and lack of confidence in healthy building initiatives","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
